#Direct Animation

= Introduction =

Writing directly to the panels

= Details =

Writing directly to the panels is as easy as:
1) Preparing your output buffer
2) Dump this to Panel Buffer
3) Call the Scroll method

{{{
#include <Panel8x8.h>     // Declare an object of type 
Panel8x8 Panel8x8 Panel;  // Local storage 

// Working Buffer 
byte buffer[PANELS][8]; 

setup() {  
// Initialize with no buffers
Panel.Begin(0,0,0,0);  
// turn off scrolling
Panel.SetScrolling(0);
// direct animation mode
Panel.PanelMode=3;    
// slow it down!!
Panel.frameDelay=500;
// just for safetey
Panel.ClearOutput();
}

void display() {
 // blast work buffer into display buffer
 memcpy(Panel.iScroll,buffer,PANEL*8);
 // now output it
 Panel.Scroll();
}

void loop() {
 // do something to buffer
 int i, j;
 for (i=0; i<8; i++) {
  for (j=0; j<256; j++) {
   buffer[0][i]=j;
   // and display it
   display();
  }
  // all leds on might overdrive power supply
  buffer[0][i]=0;
 }
} 
}}}
